attributes.action: Make it legal for horses to be ridden on pavements and walkways-safer all round!
attributes.background: Accidents involving horses cause serious injury. There are no clear guidelines for drivers in the highway code.  Most are not aware of horse behaviour and how to pass safely. For everyone's benefit, horses and riders are safer on pavements.

attributes.action: Introduce Black History Month to the curriculum for primary and secondary school
attributes.background:
It is vital that we inform the younger generation of the struggles and injustice that was faced by black people. It is imperative that we are all aware of the past and the addition to the curriculum will give all races the opportunity to learn about the past. 

Through knowledge comes progression.

attributes.action: Free school meals for everyone including secondary school students.
attributes.background: Many parents work extremely hard whilst caring for their children and lunch fees can become expensive, especially when the number of children they have increase. So free school meals can help them save money and maintain the family.

attributes.action: Create a minimum free-to-carry hand luggage allowance for all UK-bound flights.
attributes.background:
Airlines are constantly removing luggage allowances. It started as hold luggage, and now carriers are removing hand luggage allowances too. 

Luggage is an essential part of flying. Being required to pay for it is unfair on the consumers.
attributes.additional_details:
Ryanair has started charging even for hand luggage. It's likely other carriers will follow suit. 

Consumers have no protection from these practices, and ultimately are forced into paying the fees, as a hand luggage allowance is essential to most people when flying. 

The aim of this petition is to encourage the government to make a minimum requirement of free-to-carry hand luggage for flights in/outbound of the UK, so consumers are not forced to pay for every essential thing when flying.

attributes.action: Request for help and assist for serious flood situation Kerala, India,
attributes.background: This petition on behalf of Malayalies in UK and their families and friends in Kerala included among the 35 Million, the southern state of India. Death toll is rising every hour, every minute. More than 250,000 people have fled their homes.The aged, young, ill and pregnant are stranded.
attributes.additional_details:
All the shutters of 36 of the 39 reservoirs have been open and it was continuously and heavily raining for the past one week.

We beg for mercy in front of the whole world, we need help

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-45216671

https://www.facebook.com/johnygeorge.kalathiparambil/videos/1830622453700580/UzpfSTEwMDAwNTE3MDcxNDIwNDoxMDY3Nzk3ODk2NzM1ODkx/
https://news.sky.com/world
https://edition.cnn.com/2018/08/17/asia/kerala-flood-death-rise-intl/index.html

attributes.action: Make Escort Vehicles Carry Highways Agency Code Of Practice Mandatory.
attributes.background:
I would like the Highways Agency Code of Practice for Escort Vehicles markings and lighting made mandatory.
I am increasingly observing so called Escort Vehicles without adequate safety warning markings front or rear including width of vehicle lighting.
I doubt they are fully insured or equipped.
attributes.additional_details:
What I am describing does not make a good Escort Operator but does bring a more safety conscious driver to the mind of the motoring public therefore safety becomes more paramount. If you like, wearing a uniform describes our profession at a glance. 
There are many of us who adhere to this practice including the equipment we should be carrying for emergency or breakdown and can be found on social media where we share some experiences.

attributes.action: Fine MPs for the non-disclosure of outside earnings and benefits
attributes.background: Following the 30-day suspension of an MP for the non-disclosure of two luxury holidays valued at up to £100,000, the House of Commons should change its rules to allow MPs to be fined half the value of everything they fail to properly disclose. This would improve compliance and public trust.

attributes.action: Mandatory invisible disability signs to be displayed in highly populated areas
attributes.background: my son is 5 yrs old, non verbal autistic, who's behaviour can be hard and unpredictable at times, especially on public transport where we have had to explain his behaviour and rude comments made about him. physical disabilities don't have to be explained so why should invisible ones?
attributes.additional_details:
hidden and mental disabilities should be recognised equal to those with physical disabilities. no one should have to justify their actions because of their disability. signs should be put in restaurants, on public transport, in schools and play parks etc and any other public places with large volumes of people ...
stop people thinking children with additional needs are naughty by raising awareness.

attributes.action: Make local Authorities pay for injuries caused by neglect of public path/roads
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement that local authorities pay compensation/vet fees for anyone/thing that is injuried due to them not maintaining public footpaths/roads/footbridges correctly.
attributes.additional_details: My dog had two claws ripped out from the root due to the local authorities neglect by not maintaining public footbridges correctly. The bridge had been covered by metal sheeting on top of rotten boards, over time and use the metal sheeting has come loose and moved resulting in my dogs claws becoming traped between levels resulting in two claws being ripped out. The local authority failed to compensate/pay vet fees even tho they carried out urgent repair work. Why should we and our pets suffer.

attributes.action: Change the voting system to proportional representation, dump FPTP
attributes.background: Proportional representation means that vote share in the population matches the amount of seats each party gets in an election. First past the post creates a huge disparity between vote share and seats in the House of Commons, with parties receiving millions of votes and just one seat. Details below
attributes.additional_details:
2015 Election:

•Conservatives - 331 seats, 11,334,226 votes (36.9%)

•Labour - 232 seats, 9,347,273 votes (30.4%)

•UKIP - 1 seat, 3,881,099votes (12.6%)

•Liberal Democrats - 8 seats, 2,415,916  votes (7.9%)

•Green Party - 1 seat, 1,57,630 votes (3.8%)


2017 Election:

•Conservatives - 318 seats, 13,636,684 votes (42.4%)

•Labour - 262 seats, 12,877,918 votes (40.0%)

•Lib Dems - 12 seats, 2,371,861 votes (7.4%)

•UKIP - 0 seats, 594,068 votes (1.8%)

bbc.co.uk/news/election/2017/results

attributes.action: Mandatory right for substance misuse clients to have an independent advocate
attributes.background: We want it to be a statutory right for people with substance misuse issues to have access to an independent advocate, like other types of patients in the Mental Health Act 2010. We feel this will allow dual diagnosis clients who can't access mental health services better access to support networks.
attributes.additional_details:
50% of people with severe mental health issues have substance misuse issues.
37% of alcohol abusers have a mental health issue.
53% of drug users also have mental health issues.
These people cant access independent advocates through the mental health act because mental health services want these people to deal with their addictions before they commence treatment for mental health.

Figures from Helpguide.org

attributes.action: Mandate a 50% reduction in all rail fares until normal service is resumed.
attributes.background: The new timetable introduced on 20/05/18 led to massive disruption to journeys. It is the passenger's responsibility to claim delay repay. It would be fairer for all concerned if the ticket price was reduced by 50% until 95% of timetabled services arrived within one minute of the scheduled time

attributes.action: Bring AS exams back and rid of A Level exams for the sake of youth mental health
attributes.background: AS exams have been dwindled away due to Michael Gove’s, former education secretary, reforms to A-Level exams. Previously, students would learn a years worth of content and then take the exam, now majority of exams are taken after the 2 year course. A Level exams are also getting harder
attributes.additional_details:
This pressure and strain leads to mental health issues such as anxiety, panic, emotional distress and depression to name a few. The calls mental health organizations receive have been increasing significantly over the years, leaving some dropping out of sixth form altogether in hand reducing teenagers motivation

To say these issues can be eradicated by ridding of the linear style would be inaccurate but it can surely reduce it and make the A-Level process much easier and more controllable.

attributes.action: Ban Abortion in 2018
attributes.background: Abortion should be illegal in all circumstances. The Abortion Act of 1967 left loopholes that allow too many abortions. There are alternatives to abortion: keep the baby, adoption or fostering, and medical research to prevent abortion being the only option when women are at risk during pregnancy.
attributes.additional_details: Many women have more than one abortion. This costs taxpayers' money, some of which goes to private providers, and increases pressure on our NHS, which is already under huge strain. 2012 figures suggest that the NHS may spend over £800,000 a week on “repeat” abortions. That is the hidden cost of abortion. The Government must invest more in educating people to avoid unwanted pregnancies and provide better support for young mothers and single mothers. Everyone has the right to life.

attributes.action: Open a coroner's inquest for every stillborn baby.
attributes.background: In 2011 a midwife signed by baby off to receive a stillborn certificate. 7 years I have fought and in March this year the coroner found that my baby was NOT stillborn. He survived for 1hr10minutes, he suffered a neonatal death and should have received a Birth and Death certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
How many more families have/are going through this? How many babies could there be that have been wrongfully categorised as Stillborn?
We need to change the law so that every single baby who the midwives/doctors believe to be stillborn receives a coroner's inquest. If this was the case back in 2011 it would have saved our family 7 years of heartache. 
Now our son's birth will be registered and he will forever be on our family tree, he will never be forgotten, what every baby deserves.

attributes.action: Make it a legal licensing requirement for minimum x2 doorstaff on any venue
attributes.background: Too many venues are putting doorstaff at risk by requiring only 1 door supervisor. I believe like many other security operatives that there should be a minimum requirement of 2 doorstaff for the health and safety of patrons and staff.

attributes.action: Cancel the franchise for Great Western Railways
attributes.background:
Continuous delays, overcrowding on the new trains with carriages locked to customers due to lack of staff, poor announcements to inform of delays. Lack of empathy to customers. 
Total disregard to season ticket holders with little or no compensation available.

attributes.action: Register stillbirths from 16 weeks pregnancy
attributes.background: I believe that all babies that are physically born should not be called miscarriages. It is detrimental to the health of the mother who has to go into labour physically push their child out of their body.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently gave birth to a little boy at 19 weeks, almost half way full term pregnancy. Baby was fully formed but not fully grown, but the hardest thing that I have had to deal with is that I have been described as having had a miscarriage. 
My body did NOT reject and dispel a foetus for natural reasons , ie miscarry, which is why I believe all ladies who have to give birth should be recognised as having had a stillbirth and not a miscarriage. All we want is acknowledgement.

attributes.action: Ban Ministers from campaigning during referendum campaigns
attributes.background: It is my view that campaigning by Government Ministers during the previous EU referendum was counter-productive. I would like you to create legislation preventing the government and its ministers campaigning for or against a particular outcome during a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: When the UK electorate has a referendum, the decision has been passed to the electorate, the decision does not belong to the Government. It does not make sense for the Government to campaign for or against a particular outcome. They should attempt to remain neutral. Please note that I am referring to the Government and its Ministers, not MP's.

attributes.action: Launch an inquiry into the possible link between cannabis and violence
attributes.background: Cannabis is a common factor in an alarming number of violent crimes, including murder, rape and child abuse, as well as suicide. As calls for the legalisation of cannabis grow ever louder, we demand the government first investigate the possible link between cannabis and violence.
attributes.additional_details: As documented in this blog, https://attackersmokedcannabis.com/, cannabis is a common factor in hundreds of violent crimes that have occurred in the UK and Ireland in the past two decades.

attributes.action: Fund more nurses and training for trauma wards in hospitals.
attributes.background: I spent 27 days on trauma ward in hospital. I saw and experienced call bells being ignored, 'red tray' patients not fed as not enough staff and long waits for painkillers. The Government should provide more funding for trauma nurses and better training for staff who work on trauma wards.
attributes.additional_details: Patients (including myself) were left on bed pans/commodes/equipment way longer than necessary and going into emotional breakdown, lashing out at staff. Patients were being referred to as bed numbers. Curtains (for privacy) were being drawn so carelessly that half the ward, including visitors, could see the person using bedpan/having intimate care done. Quiet patients were being ignored and forgotten over demanding ones.

attributes.action: CEO total income capped to no more than 60 times the lowest employee income.
attributes.background:
FTSE 100 CEOs are now paid:

•    165 times more than a nurse.

•    140 times more than a teacher.

•    132 times more than a police officer.

I want CEO pay capped to a 60 times ratio of the lowest paid in the company. If they want a pay rise everyone should get one.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.equalitytrust.org.uk/taxonomy/term/136

attributes.action: Allow Pubs/Clubs to have their own policy on tobacco consumption
attributes.background: The blanket ban on smoking in pubs and clubs is illiberal in a society that time and time again calls itself as a free one. There should be a removal of smoking bans in pubs, and the proprietors/owners themselves should be allowed to set their own policies for their own property.
attributes.additional_details: A society that values private property, freedom of choice and enterprise cannot simply impose a blanket ban, such as the ban on smoking in Pubs. This petition is designed to allow parliament to debate the effectiveness of each landlord being able to declare their pub as smoking/non-smoking as they see fit, with the same consequences and restrictions for those who smoke in non-smoking pubs as exist today.

attributes.action: Make all products state on the label whether they have used animal testing
attributes.background: Many people are against animal testing or want to reduce the number of products they buy that use it but there isn't enough information in store about the companies that use animal testing so people are generally unaware about the extent of it. This addition would allow a more informed choice.
attributes.additional_details: Due to medical progress now, many agree that animal testing should only be used when completely necessary yet the U.K. are still estimated to be in the top 9 testers in the world. People should be more aware of what's go in to the product in front of them, right there in the shop without having to search online. At total of 3.79 million experiments were conducted by the U.K. In 2017

attributes.action: Pass a law to have compulsory clear and concise labelling on ALL food and meds
attributes.background:
Allergies cause deaths and allergic reactions cost the NHS every time someone has to go to A&E.
There is currently a nationwide Adrenalin pen shortage making this cause even more urgent.
ALL Food, toiletries and medications need clear concise labelling for all major allergens.
attributes.additional_details: Anaphylactic shock is terrifying and can result in death. Anyone living with an allergy knows the fear of eating, something that should be sustenance suddenly becomes a deadly game of Russian Roulette. A simple labelling system for all consumables that is industry standard with regard to all ingredients and packaging environments will save lives and remove fear and make providers accountable to do their due diligence as to how their product is produced and ingredients sourced.

attributes.action: I want the government to allow yearly smear tests for all women.
attributes.background: Women in the UK are told to wait every 3 years for a smear test and it is too long. In the past 5 years, I have had two abnormal smear tests and I have paid to go privately every year because I am too scared to wait 3 years. Two other members of my family have had the same issue. We need change!

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for the cosmetic industry to state allergens on product
attributes.background: I recently was hospitlised after an allergic reaction to a moisturiser containing peanut oil. This was not clearly visible on the website or bottle. I want to make it a legal requirement for the cosmetic industry to make this clear (emboldened, capitalised) on their products to avoid this happening.
attributes.additional_details: This currently isn’t a legal requirement that companies need to state on products. With the increasing number of nut allergy’s reported each year as well as the number of deaths I think this is extremely important to raise awareness. The NHS reported 4000 new nut allergy’s in 2005 and the number of the diagnosis’ rise each year. It is crucial that more visibility is present in the beauty industry. Some companies name the nuts as clinical terms, making it harder for the sufferer to be aware.

attributes.action: Make emotional abuse and bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Unless there has been a threat of violence, nothing can be done to stop emotional abuse. This seriously affects mental health. This is a major problem for ex-partners and their children. Emotional abuse should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: It is also not possible for someone to leave their job for bullying and to go onto job seeker's allowance despite this affecting their mental health due to this not currently being seen as an issue.

attributes.action: Fund the provision of support dogs for assault or abuse survivors with PTSD.
attributes.background: The government could fund and support charities to be able to specifically help the availability of these dogs for sexual assault or domestic violence survivors instead the charities allowing only war veterans to obtain a emotional support dog in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Studies have shown that 20 percent of soldiers come home for war with PTSD however they've also shown that out of all sexual assault, rape or domestic violence survivors that 30 percent have PTSD. Studies have also proved that 82 percent of people (in the USA) with an emotional support dog had a reduction in symptoms like anxiety attacks and nightmares than before and 40 percent reported that they reduced their use of medication. The impacts of these dogs is astronomical to someone's daily life.

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable plastics, plastic toys  & plastic bags in the UK.
attributes.background:
According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics.
More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050.”
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother of 2 young children I feel now is the time to #endplasticuse4good.
I travelled to Kenya recently and I was surprised to discover that they have banned the use of plactic bags and so on.
We MUST all take action now to save our planet. Please support this petition!
The toy companies must be accountable and be charged for making plastic toys that are easily disposable!

attributes.action: Make people with long-term medical conditions exempt from paying for medication
attributes.background: I am a young person suffering with a long term medical condition, there are many other people like me that need medication to prevent them from getting unwell. Due to medical exemption guidelines set out by the NHS Business Authority, we are having to pay £8.60 per prescription for key medications.
attributes.additional_details:
This feels immoral to me on the NHS Business Authorities' part as it is NOT MY FAULT that I have a long term medical condition as it was something I was born with. Yet, people like me are having to suffer financially when the UK has a National Health Service which is supposed to help people like me! 

Please help me in my fight for fairness! Please grant medical exemption for paying for prescriptions to people with long term medical conditions such as cardiac problems!

attributes.action: Make an insurance on the car itself instead of the individuals who drive it
attributes.background: The insurance in many countries like Portugal, Poland or America is made on car itself instead of individuals who drive it. This would make it easier for everyone as people will be able to drive the car even if they are not its owner and will not pay huge amounts for borrowing it.
attributes.additional_details:
In the Portugal the road traffic fatalities are decreasing with each year as young people can learn to drive with their parents car. In the 2010, there was 937 road traffic fatalities and through 5 years it has decreased to 593.
Making this change in the country will allow people to save more money on the insurances and will allow young people to drive and learn on their parents car without buying separate insurance, which can cost a lot.

attributes.action: Increase fines for leaving animals in cars
attributes.background: Increase fines to £5000 and be banned from keeping dogs for life

attributes.action: Refund visa fees when rejected
attributes.background: We want the government to stop charging people for visas they do not receive. The current policy is to make the visa applicant pay for the visa upfront and then keep the money when the visa is refused. This is immoral, unjust and scandalous.
attributes.additional_details: My wife's visa was refused for financial reasons when I have earned £29,500 this year and the Home Office didn't believe it to be a genuine relationship when I have lived with her in Chile for 12 months and she has lived with me in the UK for 12 months. Considering the amount of money and time it takes to apply for a visa and the length of time an appeal will take the government should ask for further information if needed. The governments visa website is misleading and inaccurate.

attributes.action: Stop male day old chicks being killed.
attributes.background: Millions of male chicks are killed every year. Because the industry has no monetary use for them. Once hatched they are sexed at one day old. Then separated to be ground to a pulp. Not very humane.
attributes.additional_details: All Battery hens are all female. So males have no use.

attributes.action: Name one of Her Majesties warships HMS Walker
attributes.background: Captain Walker was a superb Captain in WW2 in anti submarine warfare and died aged 48 in 1944. He was a highly decorated officer who died from exhaustion and overwork in 1944, his son was killed onboard HMSubmarine Parthian in 1943.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederic_John_Walker

Walker sank more U-boats during the Battle of the Atlantic than any other British or Allied commander, and he was instrumental in the Allied victory of the Battle of the Atlantic.

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit on the motorways/dual carrigeways to 85mph!
attributes.background: 1967 was the year when the 70mph speed limit was set, since then cars, roads and driving moral improved a lot. Today 90% of the cars on the roads been made after 2005, these cars are all equipped with all the safety features to safely travel on higer speed.
attributes.additional_details:
Higher speed limit must come with mandatory minimum that should be 60mph!

Belgium, France, Holland, Germany all has a higher speed limit than Uk to improve the traffic flow on their motorways, in my personal opinion this could be a solution for England aswell.

Austria just started to test a new 87mph speed limit on a 30miles section, if that works well they will raise the limit on all of their motorways.

attributes.action: Ensure that there is a Mental Health nurse or doctor in every GP practice
attributes.background:
I feel as if the current system in place in GP surgeries is inadequate for the amount of people that are facing mental health issues in this country.

'At any time, one in six adults has a mental health condition and one in 100 has a severe mental illness.' (Nuffield Trust, 2015)
attributes.additional_details: From personal experience, I feel that you do not get the same level of care with a normal GP, as they are not necessarily trained across the mental health spectrum. They rush the 10 minute appointment because they have 100s of patients to see per day. This needs to change. There needs to be a dedicated member of staff for times of crisis, and for people that maybe need longer appointments to explain their issues.

attributes.action: Increase the lowest maintenance loans from student finance.
attributes.background: This petition sets out to up the lowest maintenance loan but keep the highest loan where it is. Many students struggle with what they receive.
attributes.additional_details: The lowest loan you can get whilst living on your own is around £4000 a year, for me, this was not even enough to cover just my rent let alone food. Many people find themselves in the same situation where they struggle to get by and are forced to basically live on the breadline by the government. The minimum loan should be upped to £5500 to avoid students getting into their overdraft and debt before even leaving university to enter the working world.

attributes.action: Raise the definition of a child in the Mental Health Act to from 16 to 18.
attributes.background: Parents of 16 year old children held under the Mental Health Act cannot find out how they’re coping. The staff are unable to share any information on the children. Children under 18 are unable to keep themselves safe, so 16 to 18 year olds should be classified as children under the Act.

attributes.action: Allow all people with vitamin D deficiency to receive free prescriptions.
attributes.background: A large section of the population will be affected due to the lack of sunshine and genetic make up. Vitamin D acts like a hormone and every cell in the body has a receptor for it, without it there are many symptoms and conditions that can occur.
attributes.additional_details: There are many conditions and symptoms of being Vitamin D deficient. Those with more melanin are at an instant disadvantage living in the UK. In order for these individuals to maintain their health, they have to bear the brunt of the cost and if they are to remain in the UK, this will be an expediture for thier lifetime. If a persons genetic make up renders them more vulnerable and this genetic make up exists within large sectors of the public, surely this should be handled as a social issue.

attributes.action: Centrally Fund a Tram or Underground for the Leeds-Bradford City Region
attributes.background: The West Yorkshire Urban Area is home to a population of approximately 2.3million people. If less wealthy countries are able to ensure their sizeable cities have mass transit systems, it should be of national concern that the UK, as the 9th wealthiest country in the world, is unwilling to do so.
attributes.additional_details: Any urban area within Europe of a similar size has either a tram, light rail, or underground network – some have two of the three. Examples include Turin, Prague, Vienna, Stockholm, Lyon, and our neighbours Manchester. HM Treasury figures show that London receives nearly £2600 per person in transport spending whereas Yorkshire and Humber receives £160. Transport for the North estimates the North is owed a £59 billion catch-up spend to bring our level of investment up to London spending.

attributes.action: Work with airlines and other countries to make all planes have disabled toilets
attributes.background: Why should disabled people only have short haul holidays and not drink on the flight? Surely this is discrimination. The UK Government must work with other countries to make airlines commit to making all planes accessible to disabled people.

attributes.action: Include an extra subject in the national curriculum about life skills.
attributes.background: We believe students in UK secondary schools should be given an extra subject including life skills and money management (e.g. how to pay bills, what benefits you’re entitled to, how to register to vote, how to write a CV, etc). This would equip students for adult life after education.

attributes.action: Allow parliamentary time for a Bill for democratic reform of the House of Lords
attributes.background: Between 2001 and 2015 successive parliaments failed to agree on Bills to complete the work of the 1999 House of Lords Act by creating a democratic elected Second Chamber. In the last parliament a House of Lords Reform Bill passed its Second Reading in the Lords but was given no further time.
attributes.additional_details: An elected Second Chamber was first discussed in the 1911 Parliament Act, and again in the 1999 House of Lords Act. In 2015 all the major parties promised Lords reform in their election manifestos, but only a Private Members Bill was brought forward. That Bill was a compromise proposal aimed at finding the consensus which had eluded the attempts of the previous Coalition and Labour Governments. That consensus can only be found if sufficient time is allowed for debate.

attributes.action: Integrate Physical and Mental Health
attributes.background: It seems logical, but people can have both physical and mental health problems. Yet many mental health units do not allow for or accommodate physical health needs or disabilities. It's 2018, so surely we should be able to provide care for people with complex or multiple needs...
attributes.additional_details: I am detained in a mental health unit currently, and am often unable to take leave because I use a wheelchair and the hospital drive is too steep for a manual wheelchair. Many units are unable to accommodate wheelchair users at all, and those that do often struggle to provide equal access, consistent access to physio, or other adaptations. This may mean some young people, purely because of their physical health needs, are sent to elderly mental health wards! THIS NEEDS TO CHANGE!!!

attributes.action: Make ‘Settled Application’ free for EU citizens
attributes.background:
There are about 2.9 million EU citizens living in the UK, the majority of whom came to the UK in good faith and are hard working taxpayers. 

We feel it a stab in the back to make them pay for acquiring 'settled' status. Why should they be the victims of brexit, when they had no say in the matter?

attributes.action: Maternity hospitals to have separate buildings for parents of baby loss
attributes.background: Parents who are suffering baby loss whether it be miscarriage, still birth or ectopic, shouldn't have to go through the maternity hospital to get checked out or give birth. Many hospitals have separate wings but you're still in the maternity hospital which is full of babies, pregnancy and reminders.

attributes.action: An NHS follow up for those suffering from mental health
attributes.background: I want anyone with depression in their medical history, to have a home visit from a professional, regularly. Access to support groups in every town. To deliver anti-depressants to their home. To signpost them to charitable organizations available.
attributes.additional_details:
For those affected to have access to a free gym membership, healthy food delivered to their door and an annual trip to a concert/show/item of interest. A postal scheme whereby every month leaflets about mental health and how to get help are posted through every door in the United Kingdom and for these to be displayed in every room in every NHS service available to both the public and professionals.
It is said that 1 in 4 people currently suffer from depression in the United Kingdom alone, 6188 have taken their own lives in 2017. It is time to make a change.

attributes.action: Scrap the 2 child limit on the benefits system
attributes.background: Limiting the children in the benefit system to 2 only. is causing unfair hardship on families.Some single mothers have absent fathers. who if forced to pay out benefits can pay as little as £1.50 pw, with no government help. how can this be fair upon the child they abandoned..
